intro: Argostemma rostratum, commonly known as the rostrated argostemma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pink, with five petals and a distinctive elongated spur at the base of the calyx. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests.
